intro: Capsella prionophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed catchfly, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in disturbed soils and can often be found in meadows, roadsides, and other open habitats. Capsella prionophylla is an annual plant, completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
